Package src.logic

Class Board

java.lang.Object
src.logic.Board
public class Board extends Object
implements a game Board for battleships this includes, a field that stores the position of the users ships, a field that signifies where the opponent has already shot and a field that signifies where the user has already shot at

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    Ship[]
    fleet
    array of the user's ships
    int[][]
    hit_pos
    field for the position of the shots the opponent has fired at the user (0 = not yet shot at | 1 = shot at)
    int[][]
    opp_hit
    field for the positions the user has already shot at (-1 = no information | 0 = water | 1 = Ship | 2 = Ship and sunken)
    int
    opp_hp
    hit points of the opponent
    int[][]
    ship_pos
    field for the position of the user's ships (0 = water | 1 = Ship)

    • isPlacementvalid

      public boolean isPlacementvalid(Coordinate head, int dir, int s_index)
      Specifically for the Bot to check if a placement of a ship is valid (true) or would interfere with another ship (false)
      Parameters:
      head - most top left tile of a ship
      dir - direction of the ship
      s_index - index in the ship set array
      Returns:

    • place_ship

      public void place_ship(Coordinate head, int dir, int s_index)
      places a Ship
      Parameters:
      head - most top left tile of a ship
      dir - direction of the ship
      s_index - index in the ship set array

    • register_shot

      public void register_shot(Coordinate shot, int response)
      registers a shot the user shot at the opponent by saving it in opp_hit and lowers the opponents hp by 1 if a Ship was hit
      Parameters:
      shot - coordinte where the user has shot at
      response - the answer the opponent gave for the shot at that position

    • dec_hp

      public void dec_hp(int i)

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds(int x, int y)

    • check_hit

      public int check_hit(Coordinate att)
      checks the own Board what an opponent's shot hit
      Parameters:
      att - position the opponent is attacking
      Returns:
      what the opponent hit (0 = water, 1 = Ship, 2 = Ship, also the entire Ship was sunk)

    • lost

      public boolean lost()
      checks if the user lost the game because all of his ships were destroyed
      Returns:
      true if the player lost else false

    • won

      public boolean won()
      checks if user won because he sunk all his opponents ships
      Returns:
      true if the player won else false

    • game_over

      public boolean game_over()
      checks if the game is over
      Returns:
      true if the game is over else false

    • save_game

      public void save_game(String file)
      saves the game by writing the data of the Board object into a file that can later be used to restore the game state
      Parameters:
      file - file name
